creator: eugene.kramer@gmail.com
text:
/etc/ant.conf prevents running alternative versions of ant on the box.

Steps to reproduce:
-- have ant installed with linux distribution (/usr/share/ant is its default
location with binary in /usr/bin/ant). In my case, it was ant 1.5.2
-- have another version of ant installed in, say, /usr/tmp/apache-ant-1.6.1
-- set ANT_HOME to this location and try to run $ANT_HOME/bin/ant
-- ant starts with a classpath including jar files from /usr/share/ant

Fix:

change line in /etc/ant.conf
from:
    ANT_HOME=/usr/share/ant
to:
    ANT_HOME=${ANT_HOME:-/usr/share/ant}

creator: jkf@apache.org
text: *** Bug 33059 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

I have added a warning to ant to whine if
ANT_HOME gets overridden by /etc/ant.conf.
/etc/ant.conf is not part of the ant distribution,
it is part of jpackage, I do not know the
current status of /etc/ant.conf

One can use -noconfig to get ant to ignore /etc/ant.conf
